eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
description: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.

parameters.longDescription: List of available cursors on https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor
parameters.name: CursorType

eventsFunctions.description: Do change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: DoChangeCursorType

events.comment: Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.
propertyDescriptors.name: CursorType

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
Instances will start their movement from their initial position on the scene.
The center position will be decided according to the "initial direction" angle and the radius.
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: EllipseMovement

events.comment: Evaluate the center of movement from the object position and properties.
Update the center when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Place the object according to the movement angle.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: JSONResourceLoader
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Loads a JSON resource into a variable.
description: Loads a (static) JSON resource from your project files into a global, scene, or object variable.
NEVER use this to load your game.json into a variable - this would increase your game size by a lot and make your whole project file available for anyone to open!

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on a straight line.
description: Move objects on a straight line or according to their angle.

It can be used for simple enemies or bullets. It's usually not adapted for players (other behaviors are a better choice) or bullets fired with the actions provided by the "Fire Bullet" behavior (these bullets are already moved using a force).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on a straight line.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovement

eventsFunctions.name: Speed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
- Stick accessories to moving objects
- Animate a skeleton
- Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is stuck to another object.
eventsFunctions.name: IsStuck

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Stick the object to another. Use the action to stick the object, or unstick it later.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Sticker

inlineCode: // Set up the scene sticker objects list - if not done already.
// Register this object as a sticker.

eventsFunctions.description: Stick on another object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stick

inlineCode: // An object can stick to only one object.

eventsFunctions.description: Unstick from the object it was stuck to.
eventsFunctions.name: Unstick

propertyDescriptors.label: Destroy when the object it's stuck on is destroyed
propertyDescriptors.name: IsDestroyedWithParent

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CancellableDraggable
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow to cancel the drag of an object (having the Draggable behavior) and return it smoothly to its previous position.
description: Add this behavior on an object with the Draggable behavior and the Tween behavior.
Use then the action to cancel the drag, and the behavior will smoothly animate the object back to its original position, using a tween animation.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allow to cancel the drag of an object and make it smoothly return to its original position (with a tween).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CancellableDraggable

events.comment: Save the object position to be able to revert the dragging.
Enable back the Draggable behavior when the object comes back to its position before it was dragged.

eventsFunctions.description: Cancel last drag.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Cancel last dragging of _PARAM0_ in _PARAM2_ ms with easing _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Cancel last drag.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Cancel last dragging of _PARAM0_  with easing _PARAM3_ in _PARAM2_ seconds

events.comment:
Move the object back to its position before it was dragged.
Disable the Draggable behavior to avoid it to be caught on the fly.

eventsFunctions.description: Dragging is cancelled, the object is returning to its original position.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinkTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Conditions to use Linked Objects as a graph and a path finding movement behavior.
description: This provides:
* "Can reach through links" conditions, useful to check if an object is linked to another through one or more other linked objects.
* a path finding movement behavior that uses objects links (instead of obstacles for the other behavior)
For instance, it can be helpful for grid-based games like:
* Match-3 ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://bim-bam))
* Tactical ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://tactical-game-grid-movement))
* City builders ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://city-builder))
* Point and click (bypass obstacles with a predetermined polygonal chain)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ArrayTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A collection of utilities and tools for working with arrays.
description: This extension adds features like:
- Combining arrays (concatenate into new array, append all children to another array)
- Finding a value in an array (find index expression, contains condition)
- Reversing arrays
- Get a portion of an array (slice)
- Add and remove lots of children at specific indices at once (fill, splice, shift, pop, add at index)
- Randomness (shuffle children, get a random child)
- Mathematical operations using arrays (sum of all numbers, biggest/smallest number, average number, median number)
- Sort numbers in an array
- String inter-operation (split string into array, join array array children to string)

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// At the position of the array (i), remove 1 element (the array),
// and insert elements of b (the contents of the array) in-place of the array.
// Skip over the elements that were just added as we are flattening only 1 level deep
// If deep, the current element has been replaced with another, we need to recheck it on next iteration.
// If not deep, the current element is now the one after the array elements and needs to be checked too.
// In both case, decreasing by 1 is necessary.

parameters.longDescription: If yes, will continue flattening until there is no arrays in the array anymore.

eventsFunctions.description: Split a string into an array of strings via a separator.
eventsFunctions.name: ObjectSplitString
eventsFunctions.sentence: Split string _PARAM1_ via separator _PARAM2_ into array _PARAM4_ of _PARAM3_

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a clean new array

parameters.description: The separator to use to split the string
parameters.longDescription: For example, if you have a string "Hello World", and the separator is a space (" "), the resulting array would be ["Hello", "World"]. If the separator is an empty string (""), it will make an element per character (["H", "e", "l", "l", "o", " ", "W", "o", "r", "l", "d"]).
parameters.name: Separator

parameters.description: The object the variable is from
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Array where to store the results
parameters.name: Array
